thread.title: Navratri 2015, Outfit of the Day 8: Look stunning in Pink with these styling tips
thread.title_full: Navratri 2015, Outfit of the Day 8: Look stunning in Pink with these styling tips

author: Maggie Davis
title: Navratri 2015, Outfit of the Day 8: Look stunning in Pink with these styling tips
text:
Navratri 2015, Outfit of the Day 8: Look stunning in Pink with these styling tips By Maggie Davis on October 20, 2015 at 12:48 AM Comments When anyone speaks of colour pink, the only thing that comes to our mind is that it is a very girly colour. Pink is meant for girls and blue for boys. But in this modern era, even boys don outfits that are pink in colour. As we speak of this beautiful shade, tomorrow that is the eighth day of Navratri, the colour code is pink. Now there might be even girls who would hate to step out in colour pink. So here we bring to you some styling tips that would make you fall in love with the colour pink. Outfit #1 The broad chicken material bottom with an asymmetric top and a printed dupatta will surely make you look like a diva. If not, you could even try the long simple white skirt with a blingy dory attached to it and an embroidered pink top. The classy saree always works the best in any occasion. But add on the glam, complete your look with minimal jewellery. (ALSO READ: Navratri 2015, Outfit of the Day 7: Ways to look fabulous in White) Hairstyle Ideas Some girls usually love styling their hair for every occasion and Navratri is the perfect time. As the colour code is pink, for those who are interested could do some pink highlights to your hair and braid it. If not, you could use some hair accessories and you’re ready to go. (ALSO READ: Navratri 2015, Outfit of the Day 6: Ideas to look stylish in Orange attire) Outfit Idea #2 The handsome hunks are little hesitant to wear pink colour outfit. But there is ways out to not wear pink yet don pink without feeling any uneasiness. For those who are quite cool in wearing the pink attire can try a kurta with some beaded work to get the royal look. Some of you could wear any colour attire that will match to a pink dupatta. And those who literally run away from colour pink could rather wear a pink turban and stylishly follow the theme. (ALSO READ: Navratri 2015, Outfit of the Day 5: Look super stylish in Gray outfit) Hope you liked these simple ideas for tonight’s garba night. Have fun folks!
